intro: Lomaxeta verrucosa, commonly known as the疣茎草, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Lomaxeta verrucosa is noted for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies for its anti-inflammatory effects.
